intro: Chamaesaracha echinata, commonly known as the spiny chamaesaracha, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, shrub-like appearance. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Chamaesaracha echinata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
